name: Accelerated Shields
desc: Increases the turn rate of the ship's shields by %s percent and the rate at which the shields are raised by %s percent.
short: Increases shield turn rate and extension speed.

name: Advanced Optics
desc: Extends the range of beam weapons by %s su, but reduces their turn rate by %s percent. Cumulative with Integrated Targeting Unit.
short: Increases beam weapon range.

name: Advanced Turret Gyros
desc: Increases the turn rate of all turrets by %s percent.
short: Increases turret turn rate.

name: Armored Weapon Mounts
desc: Increases the durability of all weapons by %s percent, but decreases their turn rate by %s percent. Also increases the ship's armor by %s percent.
short: Makes weapons harder to disable.

name: Augmented Drive Field
desc: Increases the maximum burn level by %s. The higher drive emissions interfere with sensor operation, reducing their strength by %s percent, and also increase the ship's sensor profile by %s percent.
short: Increases maximum burn level, penalty to sensors.

name: Automated Repair Unit
desc:
Reduces the time required to repair disabled weapons and engines (in combat) by %s percent.

Also increases the combat readiness recovery and repair rates by %s percent. The per-day supply consumption for CR recovery is increased to account for the increased recovery rate, but the total supply cost remains the same.
short: Increases weapon repair rate in combat.

name: Auxiliary Thrusters
desc: Increases the ship's maneuverability by %s percent.
short: Increases maneuverability.

name: Blast Doors
desc:
Installs additional hermetic and heavily reinforced doors at critical junctures throughout the ship. Increases hull integrity by %s.

Ship takes %s fewer crew casualties from hull damage sustained in combat.
short: Increases hull integrity, reduces crew casualties.

name: Converted Hangar
desc:
Converts the ship's standard shuttle hangar to house an improvised fighter bay. This makeshift bay takes longer to launch replacement fighters (%s for destroyers, %s for cruisers, %s for capital ships), and is incapable of quickly relaunching returning fighters.

Increases the minimum crew required by %s to account for pilots and bay crews.

Can not be installed on frigates, phase ships, or ships that already have proper fighter bays.
short: Improvised fighter bay for non-carriers.

name: Dedicated Targeting Core
desc:
Increases the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s percent for cruisers/capital ships.

Can not be installed on a frigate or a destroyer, and can not work in conjunction with Integrated Targeting Unit.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.

name: ECCM Package
desc:
Reduces the chance for missiles launched by the ship to be affected by electronic counter-measures and flares by %s. A CPU core adjunct in each missile also improves the tracking algorithm (if any) and effective engine performance.

Reduces the weapon range reduction due to superior enemy Electronic Warfare by %s.
short: Improves missile speed and guidance, reduces effect of enemy EW.

name: ECM Package
desc: When deployed in combat, grants %s/%s/%s/%s percent ECM rating, depending on this ship's hull size.
short: Increases ship's ECM rating.

name: Expanded Deck Crew
desc:
Reduces the rate at which the fighter replacement rate decreases due to fighter losses by %s, and increases the rate at which it recovers by %s.

Increases the crew required by %s per fighter bay.
short: Improves fighter replacement rate, increases crew requirements.

name: Expanded Magazines
desc: Increases the ammo capacity or the number of charges for ballistic and energy weapons by %s percent.
short: Increases ammo/charges for ballistic and energy weapons.

name: Expanded Missile Racks
desc: Increases the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s percent.
short: Increases missile weapon ammo.

name: Extended Shields
desc: Increases the shield's coverage by %s degrees.
short: Increases maximum shield arc.

name: Flux Coil Adjunct
desc: Increases the ship's flux capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux capacitors - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of capacitors.
short: Increases flux capacity.

name: Flux Distributor
desc: Increases the ship's flux dissipation by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux vents - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of vents.
short: Increases flux dissipation.

name: Shield Conversion - Front
desc:
Locks the ship's omni-directional shield emitter to a front-facing position and extends its arc by %s percent. In addition, the stable emitter position results in a %s percent reduction to the shield's upkeep cost.

As with all frontal emitters, the shield will also deploy twice as quickly.
short: Converts omni shield to front, extends arc.

name: Makeshift Shield Generator
desc:
Installs a makeshift, inefficient shield generator on the ship. The shield emitter is locked in a forward-facing position and has a %s degree arc.

The shield generator draws much of its power from engines and reduces the ship's top speed by %s.
short: Installs basic shields on shieldless ship. Reduces top speed.

name: Hardened Shields
desc: Reduces the amount of damage taken by shields by %s percent. Also reduces the chance that shields will be pierced by EMP arcs from weapons like the Ion Beam.
short: Reduces damage taken by shields.

name: Hardened Subsystems
desc:
Increases peak operating time for ships that suffer degraded performance from extended deployment by %s.

Also reduces the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.
short: Increases peak time, CR degrades more slowly.

name: Heavy Armor
desc: Increases the ship's armor by %s/%s/%s/%s points, depending on hull size. Also reduces its maneuverability by %s percent.
short: Increases armor, reduces maneuverability.

name: Insulated Engine Assembly
desc:
Increases the durability of the ship's engines by %s percent, and the ship's hull integrity by %s percent.

The ship also has %s percent less sensor profile.
short: Makes engines harder to disable, lowers sensor profile.

name: Integrated Point Defense AI
desc: Gives all small non-missile weapons the ability to automatically target incoming enemy missiles.
short: All small non-missile weapons act as point-defense.

name: Integrated Targeting Unit
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s/%s/%s percent, depending on hull size. Can not work in conjunction with Dedicated Targeting Core.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.

name: Nav Relay
desc: When deployed in combat, increases the top speed of other ships in your fleet by %s/%s/%s/%s percent, depending on this ship's hull size.
short: Increases top speed of other ships.

name: Shield Conversion - Omni
desc: Converts frontal shields to omni-directional at the cost of reducing the shield's arc by %s.
short: Converts front shield to omni, reduces arc.

name: Operations Center
desc: Increases the command point recovery rate by %s when installed on the flagship.
short: Increases command point recovery rate when on flagship.

name: Recovery Shuttles
desc: Reduces the casualties suffered by fighter pilots by %s.
short: Reduces fighter pilot casualties.

name: Reinforced Bulkheads
desc: Increases the ship's hull integrity by %s percent. If disabled, the ship will not break apart and is almost always recoverable after the battle.
short: Increases hull integrity; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: Resistant Flux Conduits
desc: Decreases the amount of damage dealt by EMP weapons (such as Ion Cannons) by %s percent. Also increases the ship's flux dissipation rate while venting by %s percent.
short: Reduces amount of EMP damage taken, improves venting.

name: Safety Overrides
desc:
Disabling safety protocols increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s (depending on ship size, with a corresponding increase in acceleration) and allows the zero-flux engine boost to take effect regardless of flux level. The flux dissipation rate, including that of additional vents, is increased by a factor of %s.

Reduces the peak performance time by a factor of %s, prevents the use of active venting, and drastically reduces weapon ranges past %s units.

Can not be installed on civilian or capital ships.
short: Drastic improvement in performance, much lower peak time.

name: Solar Shielding
desc:
Originally developed by Diktat engineers after spending cycles dealing with the unique conditions of the inner Askonia system. Decreases the effect operating in a solar corona has on combat readiness by %s percent; also has the same effect against storms in deep hyperspace.

In combat situations, reduces beam damage taken by %s percent.
short: Reduces effect of being in corona and beam damage taken.

name: Stabilized Shields
desc: Reduces the amount of soft flux raised shields generate per second by %s percent. Does not affect the hard flux generated as a result of shields taking damage.
short: Reduces flux upkeep for shields.

name: Surveying Equipment
desc: Reduces the heavy machinery and supplies required to perform surveys by %s/%s/%s/%s depending on hull size, down to a minimum of %s for each.
short: Reduces resource requirements for surveying.

name: Unstable Injector
desc:
Increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s/%s su/second, depending on hull size.

Interferes with targeting systems, reducing weapon range by %s percent.
short: Increases speed, reduces weapon range.

name: Shielded Cargo Holds
desc: Commonly found on ships that can't always rely on shields to protect their cargo from cosmic radiation. Only a few tweaks are needed to have the shielding confound long-range cargo scans, reducing the probability of contraband being detected.
short: Improves chance to avoid detection of contraband.

name: Salvage Gantry
desc:
Increases the resources gained from salvaging derelicts, floating hulks, and other such by %s/%s/%s/%s percent, depending on hull size, up to a fleetwide maximum equal to the salvage difficulty rating.

Does not affect the chance of recovering special items like weapons and fighter LPCs.
short: Increases resources gained from salvage.

name: Phase Field
desc: The ship is able to run a low-grade phase field for extended periods of time, reducing its effective sensor profile to zero.
short: Reduces sensor profile.

name: Flux Shunt
desc: Allows the ship to dissipate hard flux at %s percent of the normal rate while shields are on.
short: Allows dissipation of hard flux while shields are up.

name: Civilian-grade Hull
desc: Increases sensor profile by %s percent. Reduces sensor strength by %s percent.
short: Increases sensor profile, reduces sensor strength.

name: High Maintenance
desc: Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.
short: Increases maintenance cost.

name: High Resolution Sensors
desc: Increases sensor strength by %s points.
short: Increases sensor strength.

name: Monofilament Tow Cable
desc:
Improves the maximum burn level of the slowest ship in the fleet by 1. Multiple tugs can not be used to speed up the same ship by more than 1.

Can not be used in combat.
short: Increases burn level of another ship.

name: Drive Field Stabilizer
desc:
Stabilizes the fleet's drive bubble, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet by %s. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.

Increases the ship's sensor profile by %s.
short: Reduces fleetwide fuel use.

name: Delicate Machinery
desc:
The ship systems require excessive maintenance and do not stand up well under the rigours of prolonged engagements.

Increases the rate of in-combat CR decay after peak performance time runs out by %s.
short: Increases CR decay rate after peak time runs out.

name: Heavy Ballistics Integration
desc: Reduces the ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons by %s.
short: Reduces ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons.

name: Automated Ship
desc: This ship is fully automated, and does not require - and can not take on - any human crew.
short: Does not require and can not support crew.

name: Advanced Targeting Core
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.
short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

name: Targeting Supercomputer
desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Also increases target-leading accuracy and greatly increases in-combat sensor range.
short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

name: Vast Bulk
desc: The main body of this structure is vast and is, for practical purposes, capable of absorbing any amount of damage from conventional weapons without being destroyed.

name: Axial Rotation
desc: This structure constantly rotates around its axis.

name: Reduced Explosion
desc: Reduced explosion radius and damage.

name: Always Detaches
desc: Always detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: Never Detaches
desc: Never detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

name: No Weapon Flux
desc: Weapon fire costs no flux. Used on fighters for fine-grained control of effective shield hitpoints.

name: Fourteenth Battlegroup
desc: This ship is a survivor of the original 14th Domain Battlegroup which founded the Hegemony. It is a prime specimen of the Domain Navy's "decisive battle" doctrine, particularly exhibited by a series of radical structural modifications (performed with pre-Collapse industrial methods) which allow the mounting of heavier armor plating by a flat increase of %s standard units, with only a %s percent reduction in speed and maneuverability. Exceptionally well-tuned energy systems increase flux throughput and capacity by %s percent over standard examples of this hull.

name: Militarized Hegemony Auxiliary
desc: This ship is - or was - on the Hegemony auxiliary list. Uparmour kits applied at Hegemony Naval yards resulting in no loss of performance for a %s/%s/%s/%s percent increase in armor strength, depending on hull size. Core power systems have been upgraded to military standards resulting in a %s percent improvement in overall handling, %s percent increase in flux capacity, as well as a %s percent increase in flux dissipation.

name: Compromised Armor
desc:
This ship's armor has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Armor rating reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Compromised Hull
desc:
This ship's hull has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Degraded Engines
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's engines are suffering from permanently degraded performance. 

Top speed and maneuverability in combat reduced by %s. Maximum burn level decreased by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Faulty Power Grid
desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's power grid will never be capable of achieving peak performance.

Flux capacity reduced by %s. Flux dissipation rate reduced by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Phase Coil Instability
desc:
The phase coils on this ship are impossible to calibrate properly due to subtle flaws. Reduces the phase-time bonus by %s, reduces the peak performance time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Structural Damage
desc:
This ship's hull has likely taken extreme damage in the past, possibly to the point of breaking apart. Armor rating reduced by %s, hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Glitched Sensor Array
desc:
The ship's sensor array is damaged past any repair short of a complete hull overhaul. Weapon range in combat reduced by %s. Sensor strength reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Damaged Flight Deck
desc:
The flight decks on this ship have taken major damage and seriously interfere with normal operation. Time to launch replacement fighters is increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Unreliable Subsystems
desc:
A widespread loss of redundant components reduces peak operating time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

name: Destroyed Weapon Mounts
desc: Some of the original weapon mounts on this ship have been damaged beyond repair and can no longer be used.

name: Ill-Advised Modifications
desc: This hull's systems have been drastically modified from spec, likely without certified engineering oversight. Its systems appear to work correctly under routine conditions, but have a significant chance of critical malfunction when stressed.
